intro: Chaenorhinum macropodum subsp. macropodum, commonly known as the large-flowered horned poppy, is a herbaceous annual plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that range in color from pale yellow to orange-red, often with a distinctive horn-like spur. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring simple, alternate leaves that are lanceolate in shape. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in disturbed habitats such as roadsides and dry meadows. Its botanical features make it a notable species in the family Scrophulariaceae.
